page.title: 19GROBY POOL AND QUARRY
page.content:
{Groby Pool}is a natural expanse of water whose level has been raised at some time by the building of the embankment near the now derelict water mill. It is very rich in aquatic and marsh vegetation and over the years has attracted many rare birds to this nature sanctuary.
Groby Pool is private property but the public are able to use the margins along the road as a quiet place to watch this nature preserve.
The main{quarry in Groby}is just west of Bradgate Farm and is now half filled with water. The only mineral extracted from the ground now is granite.There are outcrops of this greenish or purplish grey rock at Swithland and at Groby in several places.
